instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Which to believe schematic or second board?
threads.message:
Hi
Im working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board I have a second board to compare with.
Schematic says there should be a chip in certain location but second board matches first board with no chip there?
Am I correct in believing the second board?
In the <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> Group
Example <RESISTOR>R5445</RESISTOR>,5475
If it runs hot when I put it back together can I assume some resistors shouldn't be there?
Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]Which to believe schematic or second board?
threads.message:
If it is not there on another board it is probably an unused sensor. Schematic can be confusing sometimes. 

What do you mean by running hot?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Which to believe schematic or second board?
threads.message:
Hi Duke,
When I startup the machine everything works but the board gets hot neat the processor.
Ill remove the chips first comparing boards Clean the board and try again.
Problem is I pulled chips off the second board so I don't have a great comparison but Ill give it a shot.
Thanks as usual!

threads.title: [SOLVED]Which to believe schematic or second board?
threads.message: I still don't know what you mean with hot. Seems to me this board is fine unless it is shutting down or drawing excessive power and draining battery fast.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Which to believe schematic or second board?
threads.message:
Hi Duke,
I need to test again but I believe you are right the battery didn't have any juice so it was charging.
I did notice it won't start just with power supply plugged in and no battery.
Machine charges fine and starts off battery.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Which to believe schematic or second board?
